body: Hi @shanikornha, what error are you referring to? The log you uploaded looks all fine. Do you mean the `Insufficient Permissions` in the `nvidia-smi` output?

Hi @jeylau ! thanks for the quick answer. 
There's no error.. that is part of the problem. I am running the training and nothing happens. Even if I change the displayitters to 10, which means that I need to see something happens, there is no movement. To maximum itters that it shows (when it is showing) is 20. 
I also check my GPU, and it is not active. 
I am not quite sure what is the problem...
I tired all sorts of codes and solution that I saw were suggested to others, but they don't seem to work for me. 
Also, is it good that I am setting the gputouse as 0?

`gputouse=0` is the default settings, so you don't need to set it explicitly when you only have one device on your machine ☺️ Could I ask you though to run the test script with `python examples/testscript.py` and let me know if it runs fine?

> `gputouse=0` is the default settings, so you don't need to set it explicitly when you only have one device on your machine ☺️ Could I ask you though to run the test script with `python examples/testscript.py` and let me know if it runs fine?

Hi (: 
The testscript seems to run fine

(edit to truncate - full output is not required)
```
ALL DONE!!! - default cases are functional.
```

Now I tried to run again my code, and it again got stuck after interation 46, the code is below:

You mentioned python==3.9.9. 
How did you install deeplabcut? Was it with the conda environment file provided? I'm pretty sure (but I could be wrong) that python 3.9+ is not supported, and if you have built your own env you may have some dependency conflicts. And please confirm the version of deeplabcut you have installed. After importing deeplabcut, just run `deeplabcut.__version__`.

As far as your GPU, have you followed [these instructions](https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/recipes/installTips.html#how-to-confirm-that-your-gpu-is-being-used-by-deeplabcut) to determine GPU usage during training? It is not the GPU "usage" percentage that first shows in Windows Task Manager.

Hi @backyardbiomech ! thanks a lot for the answer. 
1. The deeplabcut bersion I have is '2.2.0.3'; in the main installation page I see that python 3.7 (at least) is required.. so I guess that is OK. Or is it better to use another version of python? 
2. Regarding my GPU usage: I checked how it is recommmended (I didn't see this page before). 
I saw a temporary increase in my CUDA usage to max - but then it drops, and again stops at a very early iteration (now it is 16). 
3. Do you think it might be some kind of dependency conflict between CUDA and cuDNN or something else? 

Thanks a lot again! I appreciate the help and effort 
Shani

@shanikornha - what happens after iteration 46? this looks like the classic case of windows pausing the terminal if you click on it. It seems to train fine. 

Note, it IS using your GPU:

` Created device /job:localhost/replica:0/task:0/device:GPU:0 with 9613 MB memory:  -> device: 0, name: NVIDIA GeForce RTX 3060, pci bus id: 0000:03:00.0, compute capability: 8.6` 

"To pause the output of a command, press Ctrl+S or the Pause key. To resume output, press any key. If you have enabled QuickEdit mode for your Command Prompt window, simply click in the window to pause command output. To resume output, right-click in the window."

https://superuser.com/questions/1145483/is-there-a-keyboard-shortcut-to-pause-the-output-of-a-cmd-window-while-its-runn/1145485

Be sure that "quick edit" is disabled - otherwise, if you click on the window it pauses the run.

rename.from: No training occurs/not running on GPU

body:
@MMathisLab Thank you for the answer!!!!!
I think I solved the problem. It seems that I did not upload enough videos. Now I upload many more and it is running since yesterday. 
I do have another question though. I noticed that in the pose.cfg code there is no max_iters (the line is not there).
Does it mean that I need to stop it? (I did not put in the train_network line any max_iters). 

Below is the pose.cfg code. I did not delete any line from it. Can it be that in the new updated version the max_iters is not there?

`all_joints:
- - 0
- - 1
- - 2
- - 3
all_joints_names:
- head
- abdomen
- left_front
- right_front
alpha_r: 0.02
apply_prob: 0.5
batch_size: 1
clahe: true
claheratio: 0.1
crop_sampling: hybrid
crop_size:
- 400
- 400
cropratio: 0.4
dataset: training-datasets\iteration-0\UnaugmentedDataSet_Test_DLC_iphoneDec9\Test_DLC_iphone_SK95shuffle1.mat
dataset_type: default
decay_steps: 30000
display_iters: 2
edge: false
emboss:
  alpha:
  - 0.0
  - 1.0
  embossratio: 0.1
  strength:
  - 0.5
  - 1.5
global_scale: 0.8
histeq: true
histeqratio: 0.1
init_weights: C:\Users\kornha0000-adm\Anaconda3\envs\DEEPLABCUT\lib\site-packages\deeplabcut\pose_estimation_tensorflow\models\pretrained\resnet_v1_50.ckpt
intermediate_supervision: false
intermediate_supervision_layer: 12
location_refinement: true
locref_huber_loss: true
locref_loss_weight: 0.05
locref_stdev: 7.2801
lr_init: 0.0005
max_input_size: 1500
max_shift: 0.4
metadataset: training-datasets\iteration-0\UnaugmentedDataSet_Test_DLC_iphoneDec9\Documentation_data-Test_DLC_iphone_95shuffle1.pickle
min_input_size: 64
mirror: false
multi_stage: false
multi_step:
- - 0.005
  - 10000
- - 0.02
  - 430000
- - 0.002
  - 730000
- - 0.001
  - 1030000
net_type: resnet_50
num_joints: 4
pairwise_huber_loss: false
pairwise_predict: false
partaffinityfield_predict: false
pos_dist_thresh: 17
pre_resize: []
project_path: C:\Users\kornha0000-adm\Desktop\iphone test videos\Test_DLC_iphone-SK-2021-12-09
rotation: 25
rotratio: 0.4
save_iters: 50000
scale_jitter_lo: 0.5
scale_jitter_up: 1.25
sharpen: false
sharpenratio: 0.3
`

@shanikornha max_iters is not in the pose_cfg.yaml, but you pass it when you train:

`deeplabcut.train_network(config_path, shuffle=1, trainingsetindex=0, gputouse=None, max_snapshots_to_keep=5, autotune=False, displayiters=100, saveiters=15000, maxiters=30000, allow_growth=True)`

https://deeplabcut.github.io/DeepLabCut/docs/standardDeepLabCut_UserGuide.html#g-train-the-network

You can always stop training (control +C); and the snapshots are saved (you can see the dlc-models folder has them as it trains).
